title: ICE: assertion failure: `Size(0 bytes` / `8 bytes)`  `rustc_const_eval/src/interpret/place.rs`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
### Code ```Rust #![feature(const_trait_impl)] #[const_trait] trait Func { type Output; fn call_once(self, arg: T) -> Self::Output; } struct Closure; impl const Func<&usize> for Closure { type Output = usize; fn call_once(&'static self, arg: &usize) -> Self::Output { *arg } } enum Bug { V(T), } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.72.0-nightly (371994e0d 2023-06-13) binary: rustc commit-hash: 371994e0d8380600ddda78ca1be937c7fb179b49 commit-date: 2023-06-13 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.72.0-nightly LLVM version: 16.0.5 ``` ### Error output ``` - ```
Backtrace
